notes: First-generation Camry introduced to North America. Replaced Corona. Available as sedan or liftback. Diesel option available. Front-wheel drive. Diesel service requires specialized knowledge. Data sourced from Wikipedia Toyota Camry article, January 2025 revision.

Second-generation Camry. V6 engine option added. Available as sedan or wagon. All-Trac AWD wagon variant. Growing popularity in North America. Data sourced from Wikipedia Toyota Camry article, January 2025 revision.

Compact pickup truck sold as 'Pickup' or 'Hilux' in North America. Legendary reliability. Available with I4 or V6. Manual transmission available. Preceded Tacoma name. Data sourced from Wikipedia Toyota Hilux article, January 2025 revision.

First-generation 4Runner. Based on Pickup/Hilux truck platform. Removable fiberglass top. 2-door only initially. Manual transmission available. Off-road capable. Data sourced from Wikipedia Toyota 4Runner article, January 2025 revision.

Second-generation Supra. Still branded as Celica Supra. Inline-six engine. Available as notchback or hatchback. Manual transmission available. Sports car performance. Data sourced from Wikipedia Toyota Supra article, January 2025 revision.

Third-generation Supra. Separated from Celica nameplate. Turbo model available. Targa top option. 7M-GTE turbocharged engine. Manual transmission available. Data sourced from Wikipedia Toyota Supra article, January 2025 revision.

First-generation MR2. Mid-engine, rear-wheel drive layout. Affordable sports car. Supercharged model available. T-top removable roof option. Manual transmission standard. Data sourced from Wikipedia Toyota MR2 article, January 2025 revision.
